src package¶

Submodules¶

src.export module¶

Created on Jun 24, 2015

@author: Christoph Gollan

class src.export.Export¶

Bases: object

A class to export and import virtual unit maps to other formats like csv or odML.

static export_csv(filename, vums)¶

Exports the virtual unit maps to csv.

Arguments

filename (string):
The name of the output file.
vums (dictionary):
The dictionary containing all virtual unit maps.
static export_odml(filename, vums)¶

Exports the virtual unit maps to odML.

Arguments

filename (string):
The name of the output file.
vums (dictionary):
The dictionary containing all virtual unit maps.
static import_csv(filename)¶

Imports the virtual unit maps from csv.

Arguments

filename (string):
The name of the input file.
Returns: dictionary
A dictionary containing all virtual unit maps.
static import_odml(filename)¶

Imports the virtual unit maps from odML.

Arguments

filename (string):
The name of the input file.
Returns: dictionary
A dictionary containing all virtual unit maps.

src.file_dialog module¶

Created on Oct 24, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the File_Dialog which lets you choose files from one directory.

class src.file_dialog.File_Dialog(fileext='.nev', *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QDialog

A file dialog which can be used to choose a directory and after that you can choose specific files in this directory.

You can give the file extension to search for as an argument. After clicking Ok you can get the chosen files with get_files().

Arguments

fileext (string):
The file extension that should be searched for. Default: .nev

The args and kwargs are passed to PyQt4.QtGui.QDialog.

accept()¶

This method is called if you click on Ok.

Sets the files and closes the dialog.

add()¶

This method is called if you click on Add.

Adds the selected files from the left to the right list.

browse()¶

This method is called if you click on Browse....

Asks you for an existing directory.

fillSelectList(files)¶

Fills the list on the left side.

Arguments

files (list of string):
The file names to fill the list with. The extension will be cut off.
get_files()¶

Getter for the files.

Returns: list of string
The file names.
pathChangeEvent(newpath)¶

Searches the directory for files with the file extension that was set in the constructor and shows the file names.

Arguments

newpath (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The directory that was selected.
reject()¶

This method is called if you click on Cancel.

Closes the dialog without setting the files.

remove()¶

This method is called if you click on Remove.

Removes the selected files from the right list.

updateSelectionList(selection, remove=False)¶

Updates the list on the right side.

Arguments

selection (list of PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidgetItem)
The selected items.
remove (boolean):
Whether or not you want to remove the selected items from the list or add them. Default: False.

src.layerwidget module¶

Created on Dec 5, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the LayerWidget which inherits from src.mylistwidget.MyListWidget.

It is shown in the layer tab on the application and manages the layer selection.

class src.layerwidget.LayerWidget(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: src.mylistwidget.MyListWidget

A list widget that manages the layer selection.

The args and kwargs are passed to src.mylistwidget.MyListWidget.

doLayer¶

Signal to emit if a layer was selected.

enable_layers(enable, layers)¶

Enables or disables layers on the widget.

Arguments

enable (boolean):
Whether or not the items should be enabled.
layers (list of string):
The layers to enable/disable.
get_checked_layers(layers=None)¶

Returns the checked layers.

Arguments

layers (list of string or None):
The list of layer names to search in. If set to None, all layers are taken. Default: None
Returns: list of string:
The names of the checked layers.
get_layers()¶

Getter for the layers.

Returns: list of string
The layer names.
item_changed(item)¶

Called if a layer was checked or unchecked. Emits a signal to the parent widget.

Arguments

item (PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidgetItem):
The item that was changed. Unused.

src.main module¶

Created on Oct 22, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

This is the main module.

It contains the Main class which is the main window of the application and a MemoryTask to show the memory usage on the status bar.

To run the application, you just have to execute run.py.

Look at src.run for more information.

class src.main.Main(program_dir, home_dir)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QMainWindow

This is the main window.

It is the parent widget of all other widgets and closing it quits the application.

This class has methods to handle the user actions either by itself or by delegating to the child widgets.

Arguments:

program_dir (string):
The directory in which the program is located. It has to end with the top-level directory swan.
home_dir (string):
The directory where the project files will be written to by default. If you didn’t execute run.py with an additional argument this will be your home directory. Otherwise it will be the one you gave as an argument.
check_cache()¶

Checks if the cache directory exists. If not, it will be created.

check_dirs()¶

Checks if all directories exist which are needed by the program. If not, they will be created.

check_layers(i)¶

Checks if there are layers to hide for the current view.

Arguments

i (integer):
The current view’s index.
check_project()¶

Checks if there is currently a project loaded.

Returns: boolean
Whether or not there is a project loaded.
closeEvent(event)¶

This method is called if you click on File->Quit.

Quits the application. If there are unsaved mappings, you will have a chance to save them.

The event will be always accepted.

Arguments

event (PyQt4.QtCore.QEvent)
dirty_project()¶

Lets you save your project before losing your progress.

Shows you a confirmation dialog and if you accept, the project will be saved.

do_channel(channel, lastchannel)¶

Loads the data from the given electrode and plots it.

Arguments

channel (integer):
The electrode channel that will be loaded.
lastchannel (integer):
The channel that was loaded before.
Returns: boolean
Whether or not there was something to load for the electrode.
load_channel(channel)¶

Loads a channel.

This method is connected to the load signal of the src.VUnits class.

Arguments

channel (integer):
The channel to load.
load_connector_map(filename)¶

Loads a connector map given as a .csv file.

The file has to contain two columns. The first will be ignored but must exist (e.g. the numbers 1-100) and the other one has to contain the mapped channel numbers. Choose , as delimiter.

Arguments

filename (string):
The csv file to load.
Raises: ValueError
If the connector map could not be loaded.
load_icons()¶

Loads the icons.

load_preferences()¶

Loads the preferences from the preferences file. If it doesn’t exist, defaults are used.

on_action_About_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Help->About.

Shows you information about the application.

on_action_Collapse_overview_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Collapse overview.

Decreases the y range of the plots in the overview. The step can be set in the preferences.

See src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog.

on_action_Expand_overview_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Expand overview.

Increases the y range of the plots in the overview. The step can be set in the preferences.

See src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog.

on_action_Export_to_csv_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Export to csv.

Exports the virtual unit mappings to a csv file.

on_action_Export_to_odML_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Export to odML.

Exports the virtual unit mappings to an odML file.

on_action_Load_Project_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Load Project.

You have to choose a .txt project file which contains correct paths to the data files. Loads the project by reading the .txt file and the .vum file.

on_action_Load_connector_map_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Load connector map.

Loads a connector map given as a .csv file.

Delegates the loading to load_connector_map().

on_action_New_Project_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->New Project.

Shows a src.file_dialog.File_Dialog to choose files and after accepting it creates a new project. The project consists of two files. One is a .txt file which contains the data file paths and the other one is a .vum file which contains the src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap.

The default names for the files are swan.txt and swan_vum.vum. If they already exist, they will be changed to swan(1).txt and swan(1)_vum.vum. If they exist, too, the number in the brackets will be incremented until the files don’t exist.

You can choose another default name in the preferences. Look at src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog for more.

on_action_Preferences_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Preferences.

Shows you a src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog to view and change the preferences.

on_action_Recalculate_mapping_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Recalculate mapping.

Delegates the calculating to another class. Updates the overview.

See src.mystorage.MyStorage.recalculate().

on_action_Revert_mapping_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Revert mapping.

Delegates the reverting to another class. Updates the overview.

See src.mystorage.MyStorage.revert().

on_action_Save_Project_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Save Project.

Works like on_action_Save_as_triggered() but without asking you to type in a save name.

on_action_Save_as_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on File->Save as.

Saves your project under a new name by showing you a dialog where you can type the new project name (the one with the .txt extension). After that your loaded files will be written into that file (the absolute path to the files) so that you can later load them.

The src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap will be saved to the file with the .vum extension.

on_action_Swap_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Swap.

Swaps two plots if two are selected. Otherwise nothing will happen.

The swapping itself is done somewhere else.

See src.mystorage.MyStorage.swap().

on_action_Tutorials_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Help->Tutorials.

Shows you tutorials and help for this application.

on_action_Virtual_Units_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on View->Virtual units.

Shows an overview for the virtual units.

on_action_Zoom_in_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Zoom in.

Zooms the overview in. The zoom step can be set in the preferences.

See src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog.

on_action_Zoom_out_triggered()¶

This method is called if you click on Edit->Zoom out.

Zooms the overview out. The zoom step can be set in the preferences.

See src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog.

plot_all(i=None, visible=None)¶

Plots everything that has to be plotted.

It is possible to make a row in the src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap (un)visible by passing extra arguments. This method is called every time something has to be plotted or updated.

Arguments

i (integer or None):
The index of the row you want to make invisible. Default: None
visible (boolean or None):
Whether or not the row given by i should be visible. Default: None
reset_current_dirty()¶

Resets the current channel.

reset_dirty()¶

Resets the project to a not dirty state.

save_preferences()¶

Writes the preferences to a file.

save_project()¶

Saves the project.

See src.mystorage.MyStorage.save_project().

setProgress(i)¶

Sets the progress in the status bar.

Arguments

i (integer):
The value to be set.
set_detail(i, value)¶

Sets a detail in the details tab.

Arguments

i (integer):
The index of the detail.
value (string):
The value that should be shown.
set_status(content, duration=5000)¶

Shows a message in the status bar for a given duration.

Arguments

content (string):
The message.
duration (integer):
The duration in ms. Default: 5000
showProgressBar(show)¶

Shows or hides the progress bar.

Arguments

show (boolean):
Whether or not the progress bar should be shown.
update_project()¶

Updates the project data like the project name and the directory. Shows the changed values in the details tab.

class src.main.MemoryTask(timer, statusBar)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QThread

A class to show the memory usage on the main window’s status bar.

Arguments

timer (PyQt4.QtCore.QTimer):
The timer that will be called periodic.
statusBar (PyQt4.QtGui.QStatusBar):
The main window’s status bar. The memory usage will be shown here. This works only on Linux.
refresh_memory()¶

Gets the memory usage and shows it.

run()¶

Calls start_timer().

start_timer()¶

Starts the timer.

stop_timer()¶

Stops the timer.

src.matplotlibwidget module¶

Created on Wed Feb, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MatplotlibWidget which is a matplotlib to PyQt aggregation widget.

To achieve that a MplCanvas is needed. This class puts a matplotlib figure to a canvas (which is already a PyQt aggregation). So the figure can be used like the normal matplotlib figure.

On default, the figure will not have a NavigationToolbar, but you can activate it.

class src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget(parent=None)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget

A class to have a PyQt widget with a matplotlib figure on it.

Arguments

parent (PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget or None):
The parent of this widget. Default: None
clear_and_reset_axes(grid=True, tick_params={'labelsize': 7}, **kwargs)¶

Clears the axes and sets the parameter for the axes because otherwise they are lost.

If kwargs is set, for every entry set_<key>(<value>) will be called. If not, some default kwargs will be set.

Arguments

grid (boolean):
Whether or not you want a grid on your plot.
tick_params (dictionary):
A dictionary containing tick parameters.
draw()¶

Wrapper for the draw function. Draws everything.

get_axes()¶

Wrapper for getting the axes.

Returns: list of matplotlib.axes.Axes or list of mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.Axes3d
All plots on the grid.
setup(shape=(1, 1), naviBar=True, proj3d=False)¶

Sets up the widget.

The shape format is: (rows, cols). Set naviBar to True to activate the NavigationToolbar.

Arguments

shape (tuple of integer):
The shape of the plot grid.
naviBar (boolean):
Whether or not you want to have the tool bar enabled.
proj3d (boolean):
Whether or not you want to have a 3d plot instead of a 2d plot.
class src.matplotlibwidget.MplCanvas¶

Bases: matplotlib.backends.backend_qt4agg.FigureCanvasQTAgg

A class to get a matplotlib figure on a canvas.

class src.matplotlibwidget.NavigationToolbar(plotCanvas, parent, custom_actions=True)¶

Bases: matplotlib.backends.backend_qt4.NavigationToolbar2QT

A NavigationToolbar extended with some functions for using in a PyQt aggregation.

Arguments

plotCanvas (src.matplotlibwidget.MplCanvas):
The canvas the toolbar belongs to.
parent (PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget):
The parent object for the toolbar.
custom_actions (boolean):
If true, some custom actions will be created on the toolbar.
add_action(name, handle)¶

Adds a custom action to the toolbar.

Arguments

name (string):
The name of the action.
handle (method):
The python method that should be called if you click on the action.

Returns

???
onMinus()¶

Reduces the ylim of all subplots.

onPlus()¶

Expands the ylim of all subplots.

onReset()¶

Resets the ylim of all subplots.

remove_actions(actions)¶

Removes default actions from the toolbar.

Arguments

actions (list of integer):
The indexes of the actions that should be removed.
remove_custom_actions()¶

Removes the initial custom actions from the toolbar.

src.movie_settings module¶

Created on Aug 19, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MovieSettings class which is used by src.mplwidgetmovie.MplWidgetMovie to show a settings dialog.

You can change some settings for the movie tab on the main window here.

class src.movie_settings.MovieSettings(settings)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QDialog

A class to show and change movie settings for a src.mplwidgetmovie.MplWidgetMovie.

Settings that can be made:

Settings name Dictionary key Valid value(s)
Averaging range avRange 1 - 1000
Slide skip skip 1 - 1000
Slides per second sps 1, 2, 4, 5
Title time format time original, s, ms

Warning

The keys have to exist in the settings.

Arguments

settings (dictionary):
The movie settings given as (key, value) pares.
accept()¶

This method is called if you click on Ok.

Closes the dialog and sets all settings if they are correct but if not, a message will be shown and the dialog stays open.

checkAll()¶

Checks all input values for correctness.

checkRange(avRange)¶

Checks if the averaging range is correct.

Arguments

avRange (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the averaging range.
checkSkip(skip)¶

Checks if the slide skip is correct.

Arguments

skip (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the slide skip.
reject()¶

This method is called if you click on Cancel.

Closes the dialog without changing the settings.

reset()¶

Resets all settings.

setup()¶

Sets up the dialog.

src.mplwidget2d module¶

In this module you can find the MplWidget2d which inherits from src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget.

It is extended by a 2d plot and the plotting methods.

class src.mplwidget2d.MplWidget2d(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget

A class with only one plot that shows simple 2d data.

The args and kwargs are passed to src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget.

do_plot(vum, data, layers)¶

Plots data for every layer and every visible unit.

Arguments

vum (src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap):
Is needed to get the unit indexes.
data (src.neodata.NeoData):
Is needed to get the units.
layers (list of string):
The layers that are visible.
plot(y, color)¶

Plots data to the plot.

Arguments

y (iterable object):
The data that should be plotted.
color (tuple of integer):
The color of the line.

class src.mplwidgetisi.MplWidgetIsi(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget

A class with one plot to show inter-spike-interval plots.

The args and kwargs are passed to src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget.

Bin options:

Options name Dictionary key Valid value(s)
bin max binMax 1 - 500 (> bin step)
bin step binStep 1 - 10
binMaxChanged(value)¶

This method is called if you edit the bin max option.

Checks if the bin max is correct.

binStepChanged(value)¶

This method is called if you edit the bin step option.

Checks if the bin step is correct.

checkSettings()¶

Checks the settings for correctness.

Returns: boolean
Whether or not everything is correct.

Plots data for every layer and every visible unit.

Arguments

vum (src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap):
Is needed to get the unit indexes.
data (src.neodata.NeoData):
Is needed to get the units.
layers (list of string):
The layers that are visible.
init_settings()¶

Initializes the settings.

onEnter()¶

This method is called if you press ENTER on one of the line edit widgets.

Redraws everything.

onMaxMinus()¶

This method is called if you click on the minus button for the bin max option.

Decrements the bin max option.

onMaxPlus()¶

This method is called if you click on the plus button for the bin max option.

Increments the bin max option.

onStepMinus()¶

This method is called if you click on the minus button for the bin step option.

Decrements the bin step option.

onStepPlus()¶

This method is called if you click on the plus button for the bin step option.

Increments the bin step option.

Plots data to the plot.

Arguments

y (tuple of iterable objects):
The data that should be plotted.
color (tuple of integer):
The color of the line.
redraw¶

Plot signal to let the parent widget know that it should redraw everything.

src.mplwidgetmovie module¶

Created on Apr 28, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MplWidgetMovie which inherits from src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget.

It is possible to slide through the waveforms of one unit either manually by using a slider or like a movie by pressing play.

The movie is done by the MovieTask and the data loading by DataTask. Both are threads.

class src.mplwidgetmovie.DataTask(data, titles, vum, neodata)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QThread

Loads the data for the movie widget.

Arguments

data (list of tuple of different objects):
A list containing the data. The elements are tuple.
titles (dictionary):
Contains the plot titles as values. Keys are the session ranges.
vum (src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap):
Is needed for getting the data.
neodata (src.neodata.NeoData):
Is needed for getting the data.
progress¶

Progress signal to let the parent widget know how far the loading progress is.

run()¶

Loads the waveforms of all sessions and sorts them.

class src.mplwidgetmovie.MovieTask(current, maxslide, slide_method, step, skip)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QThread

Shows the waveforms as movie.

Arguments

current (integer):
The current slide position.
maxslide (integer):
The maximum slide number.
slide_method (function):
The function that should be call to slide.
abort (boolean):
Whether or not the movie should be aborted.
step (integer):
How many times per second the slide method should be called.
skip (integer):
How many slides should be skipped till the next step.
run()¶

Slides several times per minute until the maxslide is reached or the task is aborted.

class src.mplwidgetmovie.MplWidgetMovie(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget

A class to show 2d plot data extended with a slider and a play button.

The args and kwargs are passed to src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget.

clear_and_reset_axes()¶

Clears the plot axes.

do_plot()¶

Loads the data and plots it or resets the plot.

onLoad()¶

This method is called if you click on on or off.

Loads or deletes the movie data.

onPlay()¶

This method is called if you click on play.

Starts or pauses the movie.

onSettings()¶

This method is called if you click on settings.

Shows the src.movie_settings.MovieSettings.

plot(y, color, ls='-', title='')¶

Plots data on the plot.

Arguments

y (iterable object):
The y data.
color (mpl color):
The color of the plot line.
ls (string):
The line style. Default: -
title (string):
The plot title. Default: Empty
progress¶

Progress signal to let the parent widget know how far the loading progress is.

progressBar¶

Progress signal to let the parent widget know that a progress bar should be shown or hidden.

reset()¶

Resets the widget.

setProgress(i)¶

Emits a signal to the parent widget (the main program) containing the loading progress.

Arguments

i (integer):
The loading progress.
set_data(vum, data)¶

Setter for the vum and neodata properties.

Arguments

vum (src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap):
To set the vum property.
data (src.neodata.NeoData):
To set the neodata property.
set_range(min0, max0)¶

Setter for the y range.

Arguments

min0 (integer):
The minimal value.
max0 (integer):
The maximal value.
slide(i)¶

Slides to the given position.

Arguments

i (integer):
Current slide position.
taskFinished()¶

Is called after this task is finished to clean up.

src.mylistwidget module¶

Created on Dec 5, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MyListWidget which aggregates a PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidget extended with some functions.

Is used as a base class to get further extensions.

class src.mylistwidget.MyListWidget(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget

This class is a base class for other widgets but it offers functions to add items to a list and getting them back.

The args and kwargs are passed to PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidget.

add_items(labels, checkable=False, checkState=0)¶

Adds items to this widget.

Arguments

labels (list of string):
The labels to use for the items.
checkable (boolean):
Whether or not the items should be checkable. Default: False
checkState (PyQt check state):
If checkable, the initial check state of the items. Default: PyQt4.QtCore.Qt.Unchecked
get_items()¶

Getter for the items on the list.

Returns: list of PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidgetItem
The list of items from this widget.
get_labels(checkState=2)¶

Getter for the labels of the items on the list.

Arguments

checkState (PyQt check state):
The check state the items should have.
Returns: list of string
The labels of the items with the given check state or a list containing all labels if the items are not checkable.
item_changed(item)¶

Does nothing. Can be overwritten.

Arguments

item (PyQt4.QtGui.QListWidgetItem):
The item that was changed.

src.myplotgrid module¶

Created on Nov 21, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MyPlotGrid which is just a PyQt4.QtGui.QScrollArea with some additions.

More important is the MyPlotContent. It shows an overview of many src.myplotwidget.MyPlotWidget and manages them.

class src.myplotgrid.MyPlotContent(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget

A class that manages src.myplotwidget.MyPlotWidget objects in a grid.

The args and kwargs are passed to PyQt4.QtGui.QWidget.

clear_plots()¶

Clears all plots.

collapse(step=150)¶

Decreases the y range of the plots.

Arguments

step (integer):
The collapse step. Default: 150 pixels.
delete_plots()¶

Deletes all plots.

do_plot(vum, data)¶

Plots data on all plots.

Arguments

vum (src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap):
Is needed to get the mapping.
data (src.neodata.NeoData):
Is needed to get the data.
expand(step=150)¶

Increases the y range of the plots.

Arguments

step (integer):
The expand step. Default: 150 pixels.
find_plot(i, j)¶

Finds a plot at a given position.

Arguments

i (integer):
The row index.
j (integer):
The column index.
Returns: src.myplotwidget.MyPlotWidget
The plot at position (i, j).
get_selection()¶
Returns: list of src.myplotwidget.MyPlotWidget
The selected plots.
make_plots(rows, cols)¶

Creates a plot grid of the given shape.

Arguments

rows (integer):
The number of rows of the grid.
cols (integer):
The number of columns of the grid.
reset_selection()¶

Resets the selection.

select_plot(plot, select)¶

Selects or deselects a plot on the grid.

If nothing is selected, the plot will be selected. Second selection is only allowed if the plot is in the same column as the other one and if not two are already selected.

Arguments

plot (src.myplotwidget.MyPlotWidget):
The plot to (de)select.
select (boolean):
Whether or not the plot should be selected.
set_tooltips(tooltips)¶

Sets tool tips for all plots.

Arguments

tooltips (dictionary):
A dictionary containing for each column of the grid a list of string containing the tool tips for that column.
set_yranges(min0, max0)¶

Sets the y ranges of all plots.

Arguments

min0 (float):
The minimal y.
max0 (float):
The maximal y.
zoom_in(step=24)¶

Zooms in the plots.

Arguments

step (integer):
The zoom step. Default: 24 pixels.
zoom_out(step=24)¶

Zooms out the plots.

Arguments

step (integer):
The zoom step. Default: 24 pixels.
class src.myplotgrid.MyPlotGrid(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QScrollArea

The args and kwargs are passed to PyQt4.QtGui.QScrollArea.

The change step for the height.

Arguments

The data to plot.

The color the data should have. Default: k for black.

The tool tip to set.

src.mystorage module¶

Created on Apr 4, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the MyStorage. It inherits from stg.storage.Storage.

This class represents the storage layer. It manages the project files, the data loading and the data writing.

The data loading is called in the Task which is a thread.

class src.mystorage.MyStorage(program_dir, cache_dir)¶

Bases: stg.storage.Storage, PyQt4.QtCore.QObject

The storage class.

It manages the project files and the data.

Arguments

_program_dir (string):
The path to the main program. It has to end with the top-level directory swan.
cache_dir (string):
The default path of the cache directory.

Changes the current loaded map without saving it.

files (list of string):
The file list containing the session names that should be in the map, too.
Returns: boolean
If the map is correct.

load_project(prodir, proname, channel, files=None)¶

Creates or loads a new project.

It creates the project files and loads data from the project file or the given file list.

Arguments

prodir (string):
The path to the project directory.
proname (string):
The project name. Will be the name of the project file.
channel (integer):
The current channel. It is just used to set the channel. No loading will be done here.
files (list of string or None):
The list containing the file paths. Set it to None if you want to load from a file. Default: None.
Returns: boolean
If the project loading succeeded.
progress¶

Progress signal to let the main program know how far the loading progress is.

read_file()¶

Reads the project file and returns the lines without the newline character.

Returns: list of string
The input lines.
recalculate()¶

Recalculates the mapping and sets it.

revert()¶

Reverts the current mapping to the last saved one.

save_file()¶

Writes the file paths of the loaded sessions to a file.

save_map()¶

Saves the dictionary containing all virtual unit mappings.

save_project()¶

Saves the project and the map.

save_project_as(filename)¶

Saves the project and the map but it changes the name of both of them. Existing project files with the same name will be removed.

Arguments

filename (string):
The new filename.
setProgress(i)¶

Emits a signal to the parent widget (the main program) containing the loading progress.

Arguments

i (integer):
The loading progress.

Lets you change the cache directory.

Arguments

cache_dir (string):
The new cache location.
set_channel(channel)¶

Sets the new channel and the last channel.

Arguments

channel (integer):
The new channel.
set_project(prodir)¶

Creates and sets a new project.

Arguments

prodir (string):
The path to the project directory.
swap(m, n1, n2)¶

Swaps the mapping of two entries in the src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap.

Arguments

m (integer):
The session index.
n1 (integer):
The unit index 1.
n2 (integer):
The unit index 2.

Is needed because it has the loading routine.

src.neodata module¶

Created on Dec 12, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the NeoData class which is used to load data that are in neo format.

After loading you can get different data for the units.

This class works together with the src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap.

class src.neodata.NeoData(cache_dir)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QObject

This class makes it possible to load and manage neo data.

Arguments

cache_dir (string):
The directory where the cached data will be stored and from where it will be loaded.
delete_IOs()¶

Deletes all IOs.

delete_blocks()¶

Deletes all blocks.

get_data(layer, unit)¶

Returns the data for a specific layer.

Arguments

layer (string):
The layer you need data for. The layers are defined at another place.
unit (neo.core.unit.Unit):
The unit that contains the data.
Returns: tuple of numpy arrays
Returns always a tuple even if there is just one array with data.
Raises: ValueError
If the layer is not supported.
get_distance(unit1, unit2)¶

Calculates the distance between the average waveforms of two units.

Arguments

unit1 (neo.core.unit.Unit):
The first unit.
unit2 (neo.core.unit.Unit):
The second unit.
Returns: float
The distance
get_yscale()¶

Calculates the maximum y-range of the (absolute) y-ranges of all average waveforms.

Returns: tuple of integer
-maximum and +maximum
load(files, channel)¶

Loads the neo blocks from the given files and the given channel.

If the blocks are cached the cached ones will be loaded, if not, the normal loading routine of the IOs will be used and after that the blocks will be cached.

Arguments

files (list of string):
The files that should be loaded.
channel (integer):
The channel that should be loaded.
progress¶

Progress signal to let the parent widget know how far the loading progress is.

src.preferences_dialog module¶

Created on Apr 15, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the Preferences_Dialog which shows the preferences for this application and lets the user change them. And of course the user inputs will be checked.

class src.preferences_dialog.Preferences_Dialog(preferences, PREFS, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QDialog

The class for showing, changing and checking preferences.

The UI consists of two parts, one list on the left where you can choose the category and the grouped settings on the right which belong to the category.

The following settings can be made:

Settings name Dictionary key Valid value(s)
Default project name defaultProName File name
Cache location cacheDir Existing directory
Zoom in step zinStep 1 - 200
Zoom out step zoutStep 1 - 200
Expand step expandStep 1 - 500
Collapse step collapseStep 1 - 500

Warning

The keys have to exist in both the preferences and the PREFS dictionary.

Arguments

preferences (dictionary):
The current preferences given as (key, value) pares.
PREFS (dictionary):
The default preferences given as (key, value) pares. These are needed to restore the defaults.

The args and kwargs are passed to PyQt4.QtGui.QDialog.

accept()¶

This method is called if you click on Ok.

Closes the dialog but only if the inputs are correct. If not, the dialog will stay open and you get a message.

checkAll()¶

Checks all input values for correctness.

checkCache(dirname)¶

Checks if the cache location is correct. If so, the location will be set.

Arguments

dirname (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the cache location.
checkCollapseStep(step)¶

Checks if the collapse step is correct. If so, the step will be set. Checking is made by checkRangeStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the collapse step.
checkExpandStep(step)¶

Checks if the expand step is correct. If so, the step will be set. Checking is made by checkRangeStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the expand step.
checkName(name)¶

Checks if the default project name is correct. If so, the name will be set.

Arguments

name (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the default project name.
checkRangeStep(step)¶

Checks if the expand/collapse step is correct.

Is used by checkExpandStep() and checkCollapseStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the expand/collapse step.
Raises: ValueError
If the input value is incorrect.
checkZoomInStep(step)¶

Checks if the zoom in step is correct. If so, the step will be set. Checking is made by checkZoomStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the zoom in step.
checkZoomOutStep(step)¶

Checks if the zoom out step is correct. If so, the step will be set. Checking is made by checkZoomStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the zoom out step.
checkZoomStep(step)¶

Checks if the zoom step is correct.

Is used by checkZoomOutStep() and checkZoomInStep().

Arguments

step (PyQt4.QtCore.QString):
The current input value for the zoom step.
Raises: ValueError
If the input value is incorrect.
get_preferences()¶

Gets the preferences.

Returns: dictionary
The preferences given as (key, value) pares.
itemChanged()¶

Shows the settings which belong to the currently selected category.

onCacheDir()¶

This method is called if you click on browse... next to the cache location label.

Asks you for an existing directory.

onRestoreDefault()¶

This method is called if you click on Restore default.

Restores the default settings. You will be asked to confirm this decision.

setup()¶

Sets up the dialog.

src.run module¶

Created on Mar 31, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

Use this to run the program. It adds some paths to sys.path and checks if there is something missing.

On default the home directory is ~. Your project files will be stored here. If you want to choose another directory, you can just give it as first argument.

The command should look like this:

$ python run.py [<home_dir>]

src.selectorwidget module¶

Created on Nov 28, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the SelectorWidget. It is used to represent a connector map.

The electrodes on this map are represented by the SelectorItem.

This method is called if the mouse leaves this widget.

src.swan module¶

Created on May 6, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

Can run the application just like src.run but it doesn’t do additions and checks for the sys.path.

Don’t use this to run the application. This is only used by py2exe.

src.virtualunitmap module¶

Created on Dec 12, 2013

@author: Christoph Gollan

In this module you can find the VirtualUnitMap which is used to map real units to virtual units. The virtual units can be swapped to have the same units in the same row.

class src.virtualunitmap.VirtualUnitMap¶

Bases: object

A class for mapping real units to virtual units.

calculate_mapping(data)¶

Calculates a mapping for the units based on features like distance.

The units will be compared pare-wise and sequential.

Arguments

data (src.neodata.NeoData):
This object is needed to get the data which will be used to compare the units.
get_color(i, mpl=False, layer=None)¶

Returns the color for the given unit row.

Arguments

i (integer):
The unit row index.
mpl (boolean):
Whether or not you need the color for matplotlib. Mpl uses another rgb format. Default: False.
layer (string):
If mpl is True, you can specify a layer that needs a modified color. Default: None.
Returns: tuple of integer
The rgb color.
get_realunit(i, j, data)¶

Returns the real unit for a virtual unit.

Arguments

i (integer):
The session index.
j (integer):
The unit index.
data (src.neodata.NeoData):
The data object that contains the real unit.
Returns: neo.core.unit.Unit
The real unit.
reset()¶

Resets the mapping.

set_initial_map(nums)¶

Sets the default mapping.

Arguments

nums (list of integer):
The number of units per block.
set_map(nums, vum)¶

Sets the mapping given from the VUMap.

Arguments

nums (list of integer):
The number of units per block.
vum (dictionary):
A dictionary containing the mappings and other information.
set_visible(i, visible=True)¶

Sets a unit row as visible or not.

Arguments

i (integer):
The unit row index.
visible (boolean):
Whether or not the unit row should be visible. Default: True.
swap(m, n1, n2)¶

Swaps two virtual units.

Arguments

m (integer):
The session index.
n1 (integer):
The unit index 1.
n2 (integer):
The unit index 2.

src.vunits module¶

Created on Mar 10, 2015

Bases: src.matplotlibwidget.MatplotlibWidget

Plot signal to let the parent widget know that it should redraw everything.

settings_changed()¶

Is called if you select something in the combobox in the navigation toolbar.

Emits a signal to redraw the plot.

Module contents¶

In this package are most of the modules this application uses.

Many of the modules are specific for this application. The most important one is src.main which contains the main window class. But src.mystorage is also important because it contains classes to manage the loading and writing of data, creating project files, deleting them, and many other important tasks.
